009package Ch21_GeometricOperations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
018import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
019import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
020import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * ImageJ plugin, applies a non-linear "tapestry" transformation to the current
025 * image. See Sec. 21.1.7 (Exercise 21.9 and Fig. 21.18) of [1] for details.
026 * Optionally opens a sample image if no image is currently open.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
030 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2022/11/28
035 * 
036 * @see ImageMapper
037 * @see Mapping2D
038 */
039public class Map_Nonlinear_Tapestry implements PlugInFilter {
040
041        private static final double a = 5.0;
042        private static final double tx = 30;
043        private static final double ty = 30;
044        
045                
046        /**
047         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
048         * is currently open.
049         */
050        public Map_Nonlinear_Tapestry() {
051                if (IjUtils.noCurrentImage()) {
052                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower_jpg);
053                }
054        }
055        
056        @Override
057        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
058                return DOES_ALL;
059        }
060
061        @Override
062        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
063                
064                final double xc = 0.5 * ip.getWidth();
065                final double yc = 0.5 * ip.getHeight();
066                
067                Mapping2D imap = new Mapping2D() {
068                        final double bx = 2 * Math.PI / tx;
069                        final double by = 2 * Math.PI / ty;
070                        
071                        @Override
072                        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
073                                double x = pnt.getX();
074                                double y = pnt.getY();
075                                double xx = x + a * Math.sin((x - xc) * bx);    // yes, both are sin()!
076                                double yy = y + a * Math.sin((y - yc) * by);
077                                return Pnt2d.from(xx,  yy);
078                        }
079                };
080                
081                new ImageMapper(imap, null, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic).map(ip);
082        }
083
084}
